commit.message:
configure.in (assembler features): Also make gas is configured if we find it in the souce tree.

8
        * configure.in (assembler features): Also make gas is configured if
        we find it in the souce tree.

From-SVN: r23459

files.patch:
@@ -667,7 +667,9 @@ if test "${with_as+set}" = set; then
   AS="$with_as"
 fi
 
-if test x"${AS+set}" = x"set"; then
+# Ignore any non-absolute value which comes from ${GCC_FLAGS_TO_PASS}.
+case $AS in
+/*)
   if test ! -x "$AS"; then
     echo "configure: warning: cannot execute: $AS: check --with-as or env. var. AS" 1>&2
   elif test "GNU" = `$AS -v </dev/null 2>&1 | sed '1s/^GNU.*/GNU/;q'`; then
@@ -677,7 +679,8 @@ if test x"${AS+set}" = x"set"; then
 #define DEFAULT_ASSEMBLER "$AS"
 EOF
 
-fi
+  ;;
+esac
 
 # With stabs
 # Check whether --with-stabs or --without-stabs was given.
@@ -913,7 +916,7 @@ else { echo "configure: error: can not run $ac_config_sub" 1>&2; exit 1; }
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking host system type""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:917: checking host system type" >&5
+echo "configure:920: checking host system type" >&5
 
 host_alias=$host
 case "$host_alias" in
@@ -934,7 +937,7 @@ host_os=`echo $host | sed 's/^\([^-]*\)-\([^-]*\)-\(.*\)$/\3/'`
 echo "$ac_t""$host" 1>&6
 
 echo $ac_n "checking target system type""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:938: checking target system type" >&5
+echo "configure:941: checking target system type" >&5
 
 target_alias=$target
 case "$target_alias" in
@@ -952,7 +955,7 @@ target_os=`echo $target | sed 's/^\([^-]*\)-\([^-]*\)-\(.*\)$/\3/'`
 echo "$ac_t""$target" 1>&6
 
 echo $ac_n "checking build system type""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:956: checking build system type" >&5
+echo "configure:959: checking build system type" >&5
 
 build_alias=$build
 case "$build_alias" in
@@ -979,7 +982,7 @@ test "$host_alias" != "$target_alias" &&
 # Extract the first word of "gcc", so it can be a program name with args.
 set dummy gcc; ac_word=$2
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_word""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:983: checking for $ac_word" >&5
+echo "configure:986: checking for $ac_word" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_prog_CC'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -1008,7 +1011,7 @@ if test -z "$CC"; then
   # Extract the first word of "cc", so it can be a program name with args.
 set dummy cc; ac_word=$2
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_word""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1012: checking for $ac_word" >&5
+echo "configure:1015: checking for $ac_word" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_prog_CC'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -1056,7 +1059,7 @@ fi
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether the C compiler ($CC $CFLAGS $LDFLAGS) works""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1060: checking whether the C compiler ($CC $CFLAGS $LDFLAGS) works" >&5
+echo "configure:1063: checking whether the C compiler ($CC $CFLAGS $LDFLAGS) works" >&5
 
 ac_ext=c
 # CFLAGS is not in ac_cpp because -g, -O, etc. are not valid cpp options.
@@ -1066,11 +1069,11 @@ ac_link='${CC-cc} -o conftest $CFLAGS $CPPFLAGS $LDFLAGS conftest.$ac_ext $LIBS
 cross_compiling=$ac_cv_prog_cc_cross
 
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 1070 "configure"
+#line 1073 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 main(){return(0);}
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:1074: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest; then
+if { (eval echo configure:1077: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest; then
   ac_cv_prog_cc_works=yes
   # If we can't run a trivial program, we are probably using a cross compiler.
   if (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null; then
@@ -1090,12 +1093,12 @@ if test $ac_cv_prog_cc_works = no; then
   { echo "configure: error: installation or configuration problem: C compiler cannot create executables." 1>&2; exit 1; }
 fi
 echo $ac_n "checking whether the C compiler ($CC $CFLAGS $LDFLAGS) is a cross-compiler""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1094: checking whether the C compiler ($CC $CFLAGS $LDFLAGS) is a cross-compiler" >&5
+echo "configure:1097: checking whether the C compiler ($CC $CFLAGS $LDFLAGS) is a cross-compiler" >&5
 echo "$ac_t""$ac_cv_prog_cc_cross" 1>&6
 cross_compiling=$ac_cv_prog_cc_cross
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether we are using GNU C""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1099: checking whether we are using GNU C" >&5
+echo "configure:1102: checking whether we are using GNU C" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_prog_gcc'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -1104,7 +1107,7 @@ else
   yes;
 #endif
 EOF
-if { ac_try='${CC-cc} -E conftest.c'; { (eval echo configure:1108: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }; } | egrep yes >/dev/null 2>&1; then
+if { ac_try='${CC-cc} -E conftest.c'; { (eval echo configure:1111: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }; } | egrep yes >/dev/null 2>&1; then
   ac_cv_prog_gcc=yes
 else
   ac_cv_prog_gcc=no
@@ -1119,7 +1122,7 @@ if test $ac_cv_prog_gcc = yes; then
   ac_save_CFLAGS="$CFLAGS"
   CFLAGS=
   echo $ac_n "checking whether ${CC-cc} accepts -g""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1123: checking whether ${CC-cc} accepts -g" >&5
+echo "configure:1126: checking whether ${CC-cc} accepts -g" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_prog_cc_g'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -1158,7 +1161,7 @@ fi
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether ${MAKE-make} sets \${MAKE}""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1162: checking whether ${MAKE-make} sets \${MAKE}" >&5
+echo "configure:1165: checking whether ${MAKE-make} sets \${MAKE}" >&5
 set dummy ${MAKE-make}; ac_make=`echo "$2" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_prog_make_${ac_make}_set'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
@@ -1186,7 +1189,7 @@ fi
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether a default assembler was specified""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1190: checking whether a default assembler was specified" >&5
+echo "configure:1193: checking whether a default assembler was specified" >&5
 if test x"${AS+set}" = x"set"; then
     if test x"$with_gas" = x"no"; then
     	echo "$ac_t""yes ($AS)" 1>&6
@@ -1198,7 +1201,7 @@ else
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether a default linker was specified""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1202: checking whether a default linker was specified" >&5
+echo "configure:1205: checking whether a default linker was specified" >&5
 if test x"${LD+set}" = x"set"; then
     if test x"$with_gnu_ld" = x"no"; then
 	echo "$ac_t""yes ($LD)" 1>&6
@@ -1215,7 +1218,7 @@ do
 # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_word""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1219: checking for $ac_word" >&5
+echo "configure:1222: checking for $ac_word" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_prog_AWK'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -1246,7 +1249,7 @@ done
 # Extract the first word of "flex", so it can be a program name with args.
 set dummy flex; ac_word=$2
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_word""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1250: checking for $ac_word" >&5
+echo "configure:1253: checking for $ac_word" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_prog_LEX'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -1279,15 +1282,15 @@ then
   *) ac_lib=l ;;
   esac
   echo $ac_n "checking for yywrap in -l$ac_lib""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1283: checking for yywrap in -l$ac_lib" >&5
+echo "configure:1286: checking for yywrap in -l$ac_lib" >&5
 ac_lib_var=`echo $ac_lib'_'yywrap | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
 LIBS="-l$ac_lib  $LIBS"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 1291 "configure"
+#line 1294 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -1298,7 +1301,7 @@ int main() {
 yywrap()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:1302: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest; then
+if { (eval echo configure:1305: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var=yes"
 else
@@ -1321,7 +1324,7 @@ fi
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether ln works""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1325: checking whether ln works" >&5
+echo "configure:1328: checking whether ln works" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_prog_LN'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -1353,7 +1356,7 @@ else
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether ln -s works""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1357: checking whether ln -s works" >&5
+echo "configure:1360: checking whether ln -s works" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_prog_LN_S'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -1385,19 +1388,19 @@ else
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for volatile""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1389: checking for volatile" >&5
+echo "configure:1392: checking for volatile" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_c_volatile'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 1394 "configure"
+#line 1397 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
 volatile int foo;
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:1401: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:1404: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   gcc_cv_c_volatile=yes
 else
@@ -1420,7 +1423,7 @@ fi
 # Extract the first word of "ranlib", so it can be a program name with args.
 set dummy ranlib; ac_word=$2
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_word""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1424: checking for $ac_word" >&5
+echo "configure:1427: checking for $ac_word" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_prog_RANLIB'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -1451,7 +1454,7 @@ do
 # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.
 set dummy $ac_prog; ac_word=$2
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_word""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1455: checking for $ac_word" >&5
+echo "configure:1458: checking for $ac_word" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_prog_YACC'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -1491,7 +1494,7 @@ test -n "$YACC" || YACC="yacc"
 # SVR4 /usr/ucb/install, which tries to use the nonexistent group "staff"
 # ./install, which can be erroneously created by make from ./install.sh.
 echo $ac_n "checking for a BSD compatible install""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1495: checking for a BSD compatible install" >&5
+echo "configure:1498: checking for a BSD compatible install" >&5
 if test -z "$INSTALL"; then
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_path_install'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
@@ -1542,7 +1545,7 @@ test -z "$INSTALL_DATA" && INSTALL_DATA='${INSTALL} -m 644'
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking how to run the C preprocessor""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1546: checking how to run the C preprocessor" >&5
+echo "configure:1549: checking how to run the C preprocessor" >&5
 # On Suns, sometimes $CPP names a directory.
 if test -n "$CPP" && test -d "$CPP"; then
   CPP=
@@ -1557,13 +1560,13 @@ else
   # On the NeXT, cc -E runs the code through the compiler's parser,
   # not just through cpp.
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 1561 "configure"
+#line 1564 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <assert.h>
 Syntax Error
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:1567: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:1570: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   :
@@ -1574,13 +1577,13 @@ else
   rm -rf conftest*
   CPP="${CC-cc} -E -traditional-cpp"
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 1578 "configure"
+#line 1581 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <assert.h>
 Syntax Error
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:1584: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:1587: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   :
@@ -1603,20 +1606,20 @@ fi
 echo "$ac_t""$CPP" 1>&6
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for ANSI C header files""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1607: checking for ANSI C header files" >&5
+echo "configure:1610: checking for ANSI C header files" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_stdc'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 1612 "configure"
+#line 1615 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <stdlib.h>
 #include <stdarg.h>
 #include <string.h>
 #include <float.h>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:1620: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:1623: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -1633,7 +1636,7 @@ rm -f conftest*
 if test $ac_cv_header_stdc = yes; then
   # SunOS 4.x string.h does not declare mem*, contrary to ANSI.
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 1637 "configure"
+#line 1640 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <string.h>
 EOF
@@ -1651,7 +1654,7 @@ fi
 if test $ac_cv_header_stdc = yes; then
   # ISC 2.0.2 stdlib.h does not declare free, contrary to ANSI.
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 1655 "configure"
+#line 1658 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <stdlib.h>
 EOF
@@ -1672,7 +1675,7 @@ if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   :
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 1676 "configure"
+#line 1679 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <ctype.h>
 #define ISLOWER(c) ('a' <= (c) && (c) <= 'z')
@@ -1683,7 +1686,7 @@ if (XOR (islower (i), ISLOWER (i)) || toupper (i) != TOUPPER (i)) exit(2);
 exit (0); }
 
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:1687: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:1690: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   :
 else
@@ -1707,12 +1710,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether time.h and sys/time.h may both be included""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1711: checking whether time.h and sys/time.h may both be included" >&5
+echo "configure:1714: checking whether time.h and sys/time.h may both be included" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_time'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 1716 "configure"
+#line 1719 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #include <sys/time.h>
@@ -1721,7 +1724,7 @@ int main() {
 struct tm *tp;
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:1725: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:1728: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_header_time=yes
 else
@@ -1742,20 +1745,20 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether string.h and strings.h may both be included""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1746: checking whether string.h and strings.h may both be included" >&5
+echo "configure:1749: checking whether string.h and strings.h may both be included" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_header_string'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 1751 "configure"
+#line 1754 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <string.h>
 #include <strings.h>
 int main() {
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:1759: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:1762: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   gcc_cv_header_string=yes
 else
@@ -1779,17 +1782,17 @@ for ac_hdr in limits.h stddef.h string.h strings.h stdlib.h time.h fcntl.h unist
 do
 ac_safe=`echo "$ac_hdr" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_hdr""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1783: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
+echo "configure:1786: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 1788 "configure"
+#line 1791 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <$ac_hdr>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:1793: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:1796: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -1819,17 +1822,17 @@ done
 # Check for thread headers.
 ac_safe=`echo "thread.h" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for thread.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1823: checking for thread.h" >&5
+echo "configure:1826: checking for thread.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 1828 "configure"
+#line 1831 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <thread.h>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:1833: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:1836: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -1853,17 +1856,17 @@ fi
 
 ac_safe=`echo "pthread.h" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for pthread.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1857: checking for pthread.h" >&5
+echo "configure:1860: checking for pthread.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 1862 "configure"
+#line 1865 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <pthread.h>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:1867: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:1870: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -1890,7 +1893,7 @@ fi
 # Extract the first word of "gnatbind", so it can be a program name with args.
 set dummy gnatbind; ac_word=$2
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_word""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1894: checking for $ac_word" >&5
+echo "configure:1897: checking for $ac_word" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_prog_gnat'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -1920,20 +1923,20 @@ fi
 # See if the system preprocessor understands the ANSI C preprocessor
 # stringification operator.
 echo $ac_n "checking whether cpp understands the stringify operator""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1924: checking whether cpp understands the stringify operator" >&5
+echo "configure:1927: checking whether cpp understands the stringify operator" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_c_have_stringify'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 1929 "configure"
+#line 1932 "configure"
